title: Opisthokont
summary: The opisthokonts (Greek: ὀπίσθιος (opísthios)="rear, posterior" + κοντός (kontós)="pole" i.e. "flagellum") are a broad group of eukaryotes, including both the animal and fungus kingdoms.[5] The opisthokonts, previously called the "Fungi/Metazoa group",[6] are generally recognized as a clade. Opisthokonts together with Apusomonadida and Breviata comprise the larger clade Obazoa.[7][8][9][10][11]
